text: We have been the leader in climate change for decades...our weak negotiating politicians have allowed China,India, etc. to continue to lag behind on standards.  When they allow this the US has  much higher production cost so no one will want to buy our products.  Right now people scream about tariffs raising the cost of products when it could level the playing field to start producing again in The US this would provide careers for American families. China builds 1 coal plant a week with no emission regulations.  They are simple coal burning plants with no arrestors turning a simple generator. It may only power a matter of hundreds of homes then they build another. When they start making the rest of the large countries feel the pain it will make sense. When China reports to the G7 seven years later and still hasn't come close to the goals set for them something is fishy .

text:
The atmosphere of planet Venus is approximately 96.5% carbon dioxide.  Despite being further from the sun than Mercury, it is about 2.5x hotter than Mercury, due to the greenhouse effect from its high-carbon atmosphere.  In the distant future, Earth will undergo such a runaway greenhouse effect.  Carbon evaporates from the oceans at a faster rate than it returns to the oceans.

That said, we as a species (though not all individuals) are aware of the hazard posed by greenhouse gases.  Even though the runaway greenhouse effect is inevitable, we shouldn't be accelerating it.  We should not accelerate a negative event simply because it is inevitable.  After all, it is known that every human being will eventually perish, but that doesn't mean we should terminate ourselves.
author: @ChristmasFluttershy
